title: Can we just make a mode for solo players?
body:
I'm not talking about ranked, it doesn't even have to be ranked. Just a single mode where it's impossible to have someone with you. Everyone is random. That way I don't have a duo bot lane every game, where we get an inexperienced support player (I main support) who doesn't build sightstone, finish their support item, or ward whatsoever. This is me being extremely salty, because I just got out of a game that was just like this.

Me: I prefer to support
Duo: We are duo bot
Me: Okay, I'll go top

20 minutes later

Duo: 0/20/0
Me: 0/0/0

Then when you said anything to them, they just blew you off. Then I get reported for verbal abuse, when I wasn't, they're just way too damn sensitive to take advice such as warding.

Did I win lane? No. Did I let my laner snowball? No. It's completely possible to lose lane without giving the enemy laner their Wheaties. I bought wards, farmed, and tried to become as tanky as possible.

TL;DR: Duos ruin the game. Make a mode for people without friends like myself.

I would much rather play with solo queue players. Duos are like two of the same person. They're either really nice and work with the team, or incredibly toxic and unwilling to work with your team. If you want to surrender and move on to another game, you can't because two of them won't surrender and they think trolling is the funniest thing in the world. So, you're forced to sit in a 40 minute game with two trolls, and an enemy team who won't end the game because "I'm so fed rn".

Duos do tend to operate at similar skill levels. Which is both good and bad. The problem is how strongly it effects the game. 
With 4 random people you are equally able to get 1 good bot player with 1 bad one. Or 2 bad ones. Or 2 good ones. Actually, the chances of getting 1 good with 1 bad are double. (correct me if I am wrong)
Thus the chances of the good players covering the weaknesses of the bad player are quite good.

With a duo it seems to be 33/33/33. Good, bad or meh. But I personally much rather have 1 good player with 1 bad player than 2 meh players. Meh can't carry or support the entire team into victory.

I agree with this entirely, however, it needs to be tied back in to OP's original point. There should be a game type for totally random, single team selection. This does give you a better chance at creating a supposedly equal field of play for all players, while increasing the chance that you will have very contradictory skill sets and levels, thus making the game a little more interesting. It's sort of like a "DeathMatch" on CoD or "Lone Wolves" on Halo.
With this point, I need to mention, that the original team selection needs to be kept, as I, as well as many others, enjoy the challenge of trying to win with a supposedly shit "Duo Bot", or entire team. lol
